Description: Fragment of foot of vessel, probably closed vase. Pattern of large drops in raised outline in low relief on the outside. Decoration may have been incised, now worn. Fragment is probably from the massive foot of a much thinner walled vessel. Thick-walled white porous and crumbly paste with worn turquoise glaze on underside, outside, and vessel inside, but not in inside of foot.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.13)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4920 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
